hints.content:
The area is the amount of flat space a shape takes up. 

We can find the area by counting the number of unit squares that the shape covers.

$\blueD{\text{Shape A}}$ has an area of $\blueD8$ square units.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A grid with 2 shapes of different sizes labeled A and B. Shape A with 4 rows and 3 columns of 8 unit squares connected together on a grid. The top 2 rows each have 1 unit square and the bottom 2 rows each have 3 unit squares. The unit squares that make up shape A are labeled 1 through 8. Shape B with 3 rows and 3 columns of 7 unit squares connected together on a grid. The bottom 2 rows each have 2 columns of unit squares and the top row has 3 unit squares. !

hints.content:
$\maroonD{\text{Shape B}}$ has an area of $\maroonD{7}$ square units.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A grid with 2 shapes of different sizes labeled A and B. Shape A with 4 rows and 3 columns of 8 unit squares connected together on a grid. The top 2 rows each have 1 unit square and the bottom 2 rows each have 3 unit squares. Shape B with 3 rows and 3 columns of 7 unit squares connected together on a grid. The bottom 2 rows each have 2 columns of unit squares and the top row has 3 unit squares. The unit squares that make up shape B are labeled 1 through 7. !

hints.content:
Shape $\blueD{\text{A}}$ covers *more* unit squares on the grid than shape $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.

So, the area of shape $\blueD{\text{A}}$ is *greater* than the area of shape $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.

question.content:
Each square in the grid is a unit square with an area of $1$ square unit.  

**Fill in the blanks.**

Shape $\blueD{\text{A}}$ covers [[☃ dropdown 1]] unit squares on the grid than shape $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.

So, the area of shape $\blueD{\text{A}}$ is  [[☃ dropdown 2]]  than the area of shape $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A grid with 2 shapes of different sizes labeled A and B. Shape A with 4 rows and 3 columns of 8 unit squares connected together on a grid. The top 2 rows each have 1 unit square and the bottom 2 rows each have 3 unit squares.  Shape B with 3 rows and 3 columns of 7 unit squares connected together on a grid. The bottom 2 rows each have 2 columns of unit squares and the top row has 3 unit squares. !
